Subject: ClassCastException in JBoss (but only after redeploy)
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Organization:

Hi Guys,

I think this is a known issue, I can see references to it everywhere but
I'm totally stumped on how to fix it.

Basically, I have a functional junit tests... but it only works when I
restart the JBoss enviroment.  If I undeploy/redeploy then I get a class
cast exception.

Here is my operating env (I'm showing in the hope someone can spell out
how to disable the classloader if it will help).

build.xml...

 <target name="setup">
  <java 
    fork="yes" 
    classname="junit.textui.TestRunner" 
    taskname="junit" failonerror="true">
   <arg value="au.com.axone.can.ejbeans.CanSetUp"/>
   <sysproperty key="user.home" value="./java"/> 
   <classpath refid="test.path"/>
  </java>
 </target>

./java/junit.properties...

  loading=false

and some versions in case it helps...
  j2sdk1.4.1
  jakarta-struts-1.1-b2
  jboss-3.0.4_tomcat-4.1.12
  junit3.8.1  (along with junitejb which came in an example)
  xdoclet-bin-1.2.0-beta1

the ant output which includes the ClassCastException is attached.

cheers, Oliver

-- 
Oliver George <me@...>

  ----------

Buildfile: build.xml

    [junit] .
    [junit] Time: 1.458

    [junit] OK (1 test)

pause:
